intro: Gochnatia rotundifolia, commonly known as the round-leaf gochnatia, is a flowering plant species native to Australia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows as a shrub, with rounded, waxy leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are yellow and appear in clusters, contributing to its ornamental value. Gochnatia rotundifolia is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, making it a resilient species in native Australian flora.
